description: Create a striking book landing page for 'The Man and the Hare: The land remembers lest we forget' by Stephen Lindley. The book is a Celtic mythology fantasy about a nameless man who awakens in an unraveling world and must face Balor, the god of endings. Guided by Merlin and joined by the fae, he becomes a vessel for the land's last hope. The book was published December 15, 2025 (112 pages) and is available on Amazon. Include: hero section with atmospheric design that reflects the Celtic mythology theme, book synopsis ('In a land where memory is older than kings and every field holds the echo of a story, a nameless man awakens to a world unraveling. Drawn by a relic carved from myth and moonlight, he is thrust into a conflict older than Camelot itself. Balor, the god of endings, has broken free. His shadow poisons the rivers, empties villages, and turns despair into an army. To stand against him, the man must walk the seam between worlds: the everyday soil under his feet, and the ancient realm that breathes just beneath it. Guided by Merlin, hunted by Mordred, and joined by the fae who remember the first dawn, he becomes something neither wholly mortal nor wholly legend, a vessel for the land's last hope. As Camelot burns and the old powers wake, he must choose what he is willing to become, and what he is willing to lose, to keep the world from slipping into oblivion. The Man and the Hare is a meditation on transformation, belonging, and the thin boundary between the ordinary and the eternal. Rooted in Celtic myth and told with the stark beauty of a dying dawn, it is a story of a man finding his place in a world where field and legend share the same breath, and where the land remembers, even when its people forget.'), author information (Stephen Lindley), prominent call-to-action button linking to Amazon UK (https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B0G819RYX9), book details (Publication: December 15, 2025, Pages: 112, Genre: Fantasy/Celtic Mythology/Arthurian, Rating: 5.0/5 stars, ISBN: 979-8277364819), and overall mystical, mythological aesthetic that feels ancient and timeless
Refine the hero section typography to be more striking and impactful - experiment with letter spacing, font weights, and hierarchy to make the book title more commanding and memorable
Verify the CTA button correctly links to https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B0G819RYX9 - ensure it opens in a new tab

Add an atmospheric background image to the hero section - generate or source a mystical Celtic landscape image (misty ancient stones, ethereal dawn light, mythological atmosphere) and integrate it as a hero background with proper overlay to ensure text readability

Add the hero background image from ./hero-background.png as the background for the hero section. Apply it as a full-width background with center positioning, cover sizing, and add a dark overlay gradient to ensure the gold text remains highly readable and striking against the image of ancient Celtic standing stones at misty dawn.

Refine the hero title typography to match the book cover style - make it much less bold (lighter font weight), more elegant and refined with a classic serif feel. The book cover uses thin, sophisticated lettering that's graceful rather than heavy. Adjust font weight to light or normal, remove any bold styling, and make it feel more literary and sophisticated rather than commanding and heavy
Replace the hero background image with ./hero-background.jpg - ensure it displays properly as a full-width background with appropriate positioning and overlay to maintain text readability
